entity.name: `<datalist>`
entity.description: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.
entity.descriptionClean: Method of providing a list of presets for a user to select in a form control, while still allowing custom options.

example.codeHighlighted: <input name="country" list="countries"> <datalist id="countries"> <option>Afghanistan</option> ... </datalist>

webFeature.description_html: The <datalist> element sets recommended values for an <input> element. Browsers may show a dropdown menu of all values or match values as the user types.
webFeature.name: <datalist>

entity.name: `<selectlist>`
entity.description: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously `<selectmenu>`.
entity.descriptionClean: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectmenu>.

example.codeHighlighted: <selectlist> <option>Option 1</option> <option>Option 2</option> <option>Option 3</option> </selectlist>

resources.title: The selectmenu HTML Tag | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Advanced Form Control Styling With Selectmenu And Anchoring API — Smashing Magazine

entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.name: `input.showPicker()`
entity.description: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).
entity.descriptionClean: Programmatically open the picker of form controls that have one (color pickers, date inputs etc).

example.codeHighlighted: <input id="dateInput" type="date"> <button onclick="dateInput.showPicker()">Select date</button>

webFeature.description_html: The showPicker() method for <input> elements shows the user interface for picking a value. For example, for <input type="date"> it shows the interface for picking a date.
webFeature.name: showPicker() for <input>

webFeature.description_html: The capture HTML attribute for <input type="file"> elements allows the user to capture media using the device's camera or microphone.
webFeature.name: HTML media capture

entity.name: `inert` attribute
entity.description: Attribute to make an element and its descendants non-interactive, and invisible to assistive technology.
entity.descriptionClean: Attribute to make an element and its descendants non-interactive, and invisible to assistive technology.

example.codeHighlighted: <div id=app inert class=loading> ... </div>

resources.title: The "inert" attribute is finally coming to the web | Stefan Judis Web Development

webFeature.description_html: The inert HTML attribute marks an element and its descendants as non-interactive. Inert elements don't get focus or fire click events.
webFeature.name: inert

entity.name: `<search>`
entity.description: Semantic element for wrapping search UI.
entity.descriptionClean: Semantic element for wrapping search UI.

example.codeHighlighted: <search> <form action="search.php"> <label>Find: <input name="q" type="search"></label> <button>Go!</button> </form> </search>

webFeature.description_html: The <search> HTML element is a container that represents the parts of the web page with search functionality.
webFeature.name: <search>

entity.name: Badging API
entity.description: Set a badge on the web application’s icon to notify about updated state in a less intrusive, persistent way.
entity.descriptionClean: Set a badge on the web application’s icon to notify about updated state in a less intrusive, persistent way.

example.codeHighlighted: navigator.setAppBadge(unreadCount)

resources.title: Badging for app icons - Chrome Developers

entity.name: `<details name>` (Exclusive Accordion)
entity.description: Group `<details>` elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionHtml: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionClean: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.

example.code:
<details open name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Main info</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
<details name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Style</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
example.codeHighlighted: <details open name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Main info</summary> <!-- controls --> </details> <details name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Style</summary> <!-- controls --> </details>

resources.title: Add name attribute for grouping details elements into an exclusive accordion by dbaron · Pull Request #9400 · whatwg/html · GitHub
Exclusive accordion (<details name="">) · Issue #866 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.
webFeature.name: Mutually exclusive <details> elements

entity.name: `autocomplete` attribute
entity.description: Provide hints about what kind of information is expected, e.g. `name`, `honorific-prefix`, `tel`,  `cc-number` etc
entity.descriptionHtml: Provide hints about what kind of information is expected, e.g. name, honorific-prefix, tel, cc-number etc
entity.descriptionClean: Provide hints about what kind of information is expected, e.g. name, honorific-prefix, tel,  cc-number etc

example.codeHighlighted: <input name="address_firstline" autocomplete="billing street-address" />

entity.name: `contenteditable="plaintext-only"`
entity.description: Permits editing of the element's raw text, but not rich text formatting.
entity.descriptionHtml: Permits editing of the element's raw text, but not rich text formatting.
entity.descriptionClean: Permits editing of the element's raw text, but not rich text formatting.

example.codeHighlighted: <h2 class="title" contenteditable="plaintext-only"></h2>

webFeature.description_html: The contenteditable="plaintext-only" global HTML attribute allows the user to edit the content of an element, but prevents rich-text formatting.
webFeature.name: contenteditable="plaintext-only"

entity.name: `focusgroup` attribute
entity.description: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.

example.codeHighlighted: <div focusgroup="wrap horizontal"> <!-- child elements --> </div>

resources.title: 1286127 -       chromium -      An open-source project to help move the web forward. -     Monorail

entity.name: `blocking="render"`
entity.description: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on `<link>`, `<script>` and `<style>`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on <link>, <script> and <style>.
entity.descriptionClean: Block rendering (but not parsing) until certain resources have been loaded. Available on <link>, <script> and <style>.

example.codeHighlighted: <script blocking="render" async src="async-script.js"></script>

resources.title: Review request on `blocking=render` attribute for scripts and stylesheets · Issue #727 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The blocking="render" attribute for <link>, <script>, and <style> elements blocks rendering until the external script or stylesheet has been loaded. For <link rel="expect">, rendering is blocked until a specific element is in the DOM.
webFeature.name: blocking="render"

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: `fetchpriority` attribute
entity.description: Allows specifying a hint to help the browser prioritize fetching various resources.
entity.descriptionClean: Allows specifying a hint to help the browser prioritize fetching various resources.

example.codeHighlighted: <img src="logo.svg" fetchpriority="high" />

resources.title: Priority Hints API · Issue #704 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub
Optimizing resource loading with the Fetch Priority API

webFeature.description_html: The fetch() priority option and the fetchpriority HTML attribute give hints to the browser about which requests to do before other requests of the same type.
webFeature.name: Fetch priority

entity.name: FormData API
entity.description: API to more easily extract and manipulate form data values via JS
entity.descriptionClean: API to more easily extract and manipulate form data values via JS

example.code:
let fd = new FormData(form);
let data = JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(fd));
example.codeHighlighted: let fd = new FormData(form); let data = JSON.stringify(Object.fromEntries(fd));

entity.name: File System Access API
entity.description: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionHtml: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionClean: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.

example.codeHighlighted: const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(); const writable = await handle.createWritable(); await writable.write("Hello, world!"); await writable.close();

webFeature.description_html: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.
webFeature.name: File system access

entity.name: Web Share API
entity.description: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionClean: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.

example.codeHighlighted: navigator.share(shareData)

resources.title: Integrate with the OS sharing UI with the Web Share API

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.share() method invokes the device's native sharing mechanism and passes text, links, files, and other content to share targets.
webFeature.name: navigator.share()

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`
entity.description: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

example.codeHighlighted: <details> <summary>Details</summary> Longer content </details>

webFeature.description_html: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
webFeature.name: <details>

entity.name: Customizable Select
entity.description: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously `<selectlist>` and `<selectmenu>`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.
entity.descriptionClean: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.

example.codeHighlighted: select, ::picker(select) { appearance: base-select; }

resources.title: The selectmenu HTML Tag | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Advanced Form Control Styling With Selectmenu And Anchoring API — Smashing Magazine

webFeature.description_html: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.
webFeature.name: Customizable <select>

entity.name: `focusgroup` attribute
entity.description: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Facilitate keyboard focus navigation using the keyboard arrow keys among a set of focusable elements.

example.codeHighlighted: <div focusgroup="wrap horizontal"> <!-- child elements --> </div>

resources.title: 1286127 -       chromium -      An open-source project to help move the web forward. -     Monorail

entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.name: `EditContext`
entity.description: The EditContext interface represents the text edit context of an element that was made editable by using the EditContext API.
entity.descriptionClean: The EditContext interface represents the text edit context of an element that was made editable by using the EditContext API.

example.codeHighlighted: const canvas = document.createElement("canvas"); const editContext = new EditContext(); canvas.editContext = editContext;

webFeature.description_html: The EditContext API allows you to build rich text editors that support advanced text input, such as Input Method Editor (IME) composition, an emoji picker, or other platform-specific editing UI.
webFeature.name: EditContext

entity.name: CSS Custom Highlight API
entity.description: Provides a mechanism for styling arbitrary text ranges on a document by using JavaScript to create the ranges, and CSS to style them.
entity.descriptionClean: Provides a mechanism for styling arbitrary text ranges on a document by using JavaScript to create the ranges, and CSS to style them.

example.codeHighlighted: // css ::highlight(my-custom-highlight) { background-color: blue; } // js const parentNode = document.getElementById("foo"); const range1 = new Range(); range1.setStart(parentNode, 10); range1.setEnd(parentNode, 20); const highlight = new Highlight(range1); CSS.highlights.set("my-custom-highlight", highlight);

webFeature.description_html: Custom highlights style arbitrary text ranges, without adding extra elements to the DOM.
webFeature.name: Custom highlights

entity.name: DOM Parts
entity.description: A cacheable representation of a part of the DOM that can be updated performantly.
entity.descriptionClean: A cacheable representation of a part of the DOM that can be updated performantly.

entity.name: `inert` attribute
entity.description: Attribute to make an element and its descendants non-interactive, and invisible to assistive technology.
entity.descriptionClean: Attribute to make an element and its descendants non-interactive, and invisible to assistive technology.

example.codeHighlighted: <div id=app inert class=loading> ... </div>

resources.title: The "inert" attribute is finally coming to the web | Stefan Judis Web Development

webFeature.description_html: The inert HTML attribute marks an element and its descendants as non-interactive. Inert elements don't get focus or fire click events.
webFeature.name: inert

entity.name: `setHtmlUnsafe()`
entity.description: Used to parse a string of HTML into a DocumentFragment, which then replaces the element's subtree in the DOM.
entity.descriptionHtml: Used to parse a string of HTML into a DocumentFragment, which then replaces the element's subtree in the DOM.
entity.descriptionClean: Used to parse a string of HTML into a DocumentFragment, which then replaces the element's subtree in the DOM.

example.code:
const value = "

This is a string of text

"; document.getElementById("target").setHTMLUnsafe(value);
example.codeHighlighted: const value = "<p>This is a string of text</p>"; document.getElementById("target").setHTMLUnsafe(value);

webFeature.description_html: The Document.parseHTMLUnsafe() static method parses HTML into a DOM tree, while the setHTMLUnsafe() method of Element and ShadowRoot parses and inserts HTML into an existing tree. No sanitization applies to these methods, so never call them with user-provided HTML strings.
webFeature.name: Unsanitized HTML parsing methods

entity.name: `caretPositionFromPoint`
entity.description: The caretPositionFromPoint() method returns the caret's character offset.
entity.descriptionHtml: The caretPositionFromPoint() method returns the caret's character offset.
entity.descriptionClean: The caretPositionFromPoint() method returns the caret's character offset.

example.codeHighlighted: const range = document.caretPositionFromPoint(e.clientX, e.clientY); const textNode = range.offsetNode; const offset = range.offset;

webFeature.description_html: The document.caretPositionFromPoint() method finds an insertion point, represented by a DOM node and an offset within that node, for given coordinates in the viewport.
webFeature.name: document.caretPositionFromPoint()

entity.name: `Intl.Segmenter` API
entity.description: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.
entity.descriptionClean: Language-sensitive segmentation of text into graphemes, words or sentences.

example.codeHighlighted: const segmenterFr = new Intl.Segmenter("fr", { granularity: "word" }); const string1 = "Que ma joie demeure"; const iterator1 = segmenterFr.segment(string1)[Symbol.iterator](); console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: 'Que' console.log(iterator1.next().value.segment); // Expected output: ' '

webFeature.description_html: The Intl.Segmenter API creates a locale-aware text splitter that can separate a string into meaningful graphemes, words, or sentences.
webFeature.name: Intl.Segmenter

entity.name: HTML Modules
entity.description: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.
entity.descriptionClean: Import HTML files via JS imports and access their elements and JS exports.

example.code:
<script type="module">
	import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' };
	customElements.define("tab-list", TabList);
</script>
example.codeHighlighted: <script type="module"> import { TabList } from "./tablist.html" with { type: 'html' }; customElements.define("tab-list", TabList); </script>
